result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dion Gene Ferguson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: $1,000 cash bond applied to 15CT196 in the amount of $996.45 and 16CM49 $3.55
Filed by Defense. Original filed in 15CT-196.

Defendant Dion Gene Ferguson in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CT196, 15CM397 and 16CM49.

9:39 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT196:
Count 1 - Dismissed
Count 2 - No contest 

15CM397:
Count 1 - DRI

16CM49:
Count 1 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Defendant makes statements on the record.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2 on 15CT196 and Count 1 on 16CM49.   Count 1 on 15CT196 is Dismissed and Count 1 on 15CM397 is DRI.  
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement at this time.

BY THE COURT:
15CT196:
Count 1 - Dismissed
Count 2 -
Impose 60 day jail sentence 
45 days jail credit - time served sentence
Pay fine plus costs totalling $1,820
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
Pay within 60 days or set up payment plan
29 month DL revocation
29 month IID on any vehicles owned or operated by the defendant - retroactive to today's date 
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
Provide DNA sample 
**bond monies to be applied to costs from 15CT196 and 15CM397

15CM397:
Count 1 - DRI

16CM49:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 60 day jail sentence
15 days jail credit if probation revoked
Placed on Probation for 12 months 
Early discharge from probation after 6 months if determined eligible and approved by agent
**Conditions of Probation:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  If DOT assessment completed and acceptable prior assessment can be used - defendant to provide
release for agent to get this information.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide a DNA sample
Original filed in 15CT-196.
Plea hearing on July 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Acalia N Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CM-397, 16CM-49 and 15CT-196.

10:09 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Defendant does not appear.

Defendant is in inpatient treatment, at Tomah VA currently. 
There is a plea agreement.

Matter to be adjourned.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Atty Acalia Halverson appointed
Plea hearing at 04-13-2016 08:30 am
to Withdraw as Counsel /s/ TBE 02/01/16
Pre-trial conference at 02-08-2016 09:00 am

Attorney Eric Sheets in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CT-196 and 15CM-397.

1:55 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Defendant does not appear in Court.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, there was a positive result and Defendant was being held for retest, then determine if Defendant will be booked or released.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, does not know the exact status.  
Atty Sheets addresses the Court, spoke with officer in the hallway to seek more information. Defendant is being retested after some time. If Defendant is tested positive again, Defendant will be booked in.

Atty Sheets requests matters be rescheduled.

Parties are to return at 2:25 PM, unless Defendant can be brought in earlier.

BY THE COURT:
Matter is adjourned until 2:25 PM.

2:27 PM Court is back on the record on these matters.
Court states appearances, same as before the adjournment.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, did speak to day report. A second UA was positive for THC, has been booked in for bailjumping charge.

Atty Cousins proposes matters be set for pretrial due to the fact Defendant is incarcerated at the moment.

Atty Sheets addresses the Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing at 01-15-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Dion Gene Ferguson in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CM-397 and 15CT-196.

9:38 AM Court calls cases.
Address is verified.

Atty Sheets addresses the Court, requests matters to be rescheduled to another date for reasons stated on the record.

Atty Cousins does not object.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Dion Gene Ferguson
Current: 520 5th Street North, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494 United States  (Effective: 12-18-2015)
Prior: 7760 Hetze Rd, Milladore, WI 54454
filed by the State

Attorney Eric Sheets in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
